4_17LQPJZz9sBC1besM5ZwKFKt9CmndJTjcA.body:
Jews may steal from non-Jews.
If a Jew finds an object lost by a non-Jew it does not have to be returned.  (Talmud/BT Baba Mezia 24a.  and Baba Kamma 113b).
A non-Jew must pay wages to a Jew, but a Jew does not have to pay wages to a non-Jew.  (Talmud/BT Sanhedrin 57a).
If a non-Jew robs a Jew, he must pay him back.  But whatever a Jew robs from a non-Jew, the Jew may keep. (Talmud/Bava Kama 113b; also Bava Metzia 111b).
It is permissible to cheat a non-Jew in court.  (Talmud/BT Baba Kamma 113a)
